context_evidences: - Musk has previously drawn criticism for mocking people who list their preferred pronouns in their online bios ( here ). In 2020, he tweeted a cartoon meme of a solider rubbing blood on his face with the caption, “when you put he/him in ur bio” ( here ). After receiving backlash for the tweet, Musk tweeted in Dec. 2020, “I absolutely support trans, but all these pronouns are an esthetic nightmare” ( here ). Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-musk-twitter-verification/fact-check-elon-musk-did-not-say-journalists-with-they-them-pronouns-would-pay-more-for-twitter-verification-idUSL1N32R28F published on 2022-12-01 19:11:36

- Musk was a key “node” of activity around usage of the “groomer” slur—we looked at both “Groomer” and “OK groomer”— from Friday, December 9, through the afternoon of Sunday, December 11, when we ran the analysis. (We also ran a second query on Wednesday, December 14, which showed similar results.) Musk himself has not tweeted the word—which, according to a report from GLAAD and Media Matters, has dramatically increased in frequency and reach during his tenure. Instead, he has been repeatedly tagged into conversations by others who are using it. Reference: https://www.technologyreview.com/2022/12/15/1065013/twitter-brain-death/ published on 2022-12-15 04:20:24

- The Fauxy's corporate Twitter account shared the piece on October 31, 2022. The tweet did not contain an overt disclaimer, but the thumbnail picture (see image on right) implied that the information from this website might not accurately reflect reality. Reference: https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2022/11/fact-check-elon-musk-did-not-fire-twitter-employees-over-their-pronouns.html published on 2022-11-04 10:42:44

- However, there is no indication from media reports to date that the company's email included a survey about pronouns. As of this writing, individuals from Twitter's sales, trust and safety, marketing, product, engineering and legal teams numbered among the layoffs. Reference: https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2022/11/fact-check-elon-musk-did-not-fire-twitter-employees-over-their-pronouns.html published on 2022-11-04 10:42:44

- Increasingly, Musk isn’t just enabling these conversations—he’s joining in. “My pronouns are Prosecute/Fauci,” he tweeted last weekend. When astronaut Scott Kelly publicly pleaded with him not to “mock and promote hate toward already marginalized and at-risk-of-violence members of the #LGBTQ + community,” Musk replied, ”Forcing your pronouns upon others when they didn’t ask, and implicitly ostracizing those who don’t, is neither good nor kind to anyone.” Reference: https://www.technologyreview.com/2022/12/15/1065013/twitter-brain-death/ published on 2022-12-15 04:20:24

- Instagram users shared a screenshot of a tweet that reads, “BREAKING: @elonmusk says journalists with ‘they/them’ pronouns in bio will pay a $16 monthly fee instead of the standard $8 verification because ‘they’ identify as multiple people.” ( here ) , ( here ) , ( here ). The original claim was tweeted on Nov. 6 and had received 463,400 likes and 51,500 retweets at the time of writing ( here ). Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-musk-twitter-verification/fact-check-elon-musk-did-not-say-journalists-with-they-them-pronouns-would-pay-more-for-twitter-verification-idUSL1N32R28F published on 2022-12-01 19:11:36
correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. Elon Musk has not banned pronouns on Twitter. While he has been critical of nonbinary pronouns and has mocked people who list their preferred pronouns in their online bios, there is no evidence that he has implemented any policies regarding pronouns on Twitter. The rumors about Musk firing Twitter employees over their pronouns or charging journalists with 'they/them' pronouns a higher fee for Twitter verification are based on satirical articles and have been debunked by credible sources. 
References: 
https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2022/11/fact-check-elon-musk-did-not-fire-twitter-employees-over-their-pronouns.html
https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-musk-twitter-verification/fact-check-elon-musk-did-not-say-journalists-with-they-them-pronouns-would-pay-more-for-twitter-verification-idUSL1N32R28F
https://www.technologyreview.com/2022/12/15/1065013/twitter-brain-death/
note_1_text: Elon Musk has not banned pronouns on Twitter.com    https://help.twitter.com/en/rules-and-policies/twitter-rules
note_2_text: This tweet may lead people to believs that Elon wants to ban pronouns on Twitter. I myself had to research that to discover that Elon does NOT want to ban pronouns on Twitter.

refute_evidences: - Thus, he could not have laid off Twitter employees before that for pronouns or any other reason. Reference: https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2022/11/fact-check-elon-musk-did-not-fire-twitter-employees-over-their-pronouns.html published on 2022-11-04 10:42:44

- No, that's not true: These online rumors were based on a satirical article published before the tech billionaire completed the acquisition of Twitter. However, a massive wave of layoffs did occur at the social-media company on November 4, 2022. Reference: https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2022/11/fact-check-elon-musk-did-not-fire-twitter-employees-over-their-pronouns.html published on 2022-11-04 10:42:44

- An advanced search of Musk’s Twitter feed showed that he made no such comment ( here ) and no credible news outlets reported on Musk having said this (/web/20221130214041/ here ). Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-musk-twitter-verification/fact-check-elon-musk-did-not-say-journalists-with-they-them-pronouns-would-pay-more-for-twitter-verification-idUSL1N32R28F published on 2022-12-01 19:11:36

- False. Although Musk has been openly critical of people using nonbinary pronouns, there is no evidence that he said he would charge journalists using ‘they/them’ pronouns a higher fee for Twitter verification. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-musk-twitter-verification/fact-check-elon-musk-did-not-say-journalists-with-they-them-pronouns-would-pay-more-for-twitter-verification-idUSL1N32R28F published on 2022-12-01 19:11:36
